sentences.en: ...countries where life is dominated by war.
sentences.cn: …饱受战乱的国家。

sentences.en: A great man can dominate others by force of character.
sentences.cn: 伟人能以人格的力量支配他人.

sentences.en: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.cn: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

sentences.en: Fathers have the power to dominate children and young people.
sentences.cn: 父辈们有能力支配孩子们和年轻人的生活。

sentences.en: From the beginning Nixon was determined to dominate the most important negotiations.
sentences.cn: 从一开始,尼克松就下定决心要控制最重要的谈判.

sentences.en: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.cn: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.en: In sum, we had the opportunity to dominate events.
sentences.cn: 总之, 我们有左右事态的机会.

sentences.en: It is appropriate that Irish names dominate the list.
sentences.cn: 名单上大部分是爱尔兰名字，这没什么不合适的。

sentences.en: Jones had set out to intimidate and dominate Paul.
sentences.cn: 琼斯开始恐吓并控制保罗。

sentences.en: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.cn: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.en: Roosevelt was never able to dominate the veterans on Capitol Hill.
sentences.cn: 罗斯福从未能控制国会中的这些元老.

sentences.en: Selling could continue to dominate as investors play it safe.
sentences.cn: 因为投资者们谨慎行事,售出可能会继续占主流。

sentences.en: Some simpleminded observers fear that foreign enterprise will dominate government circles.
sentences.cn: 一些头脑简单的评论家担心外国企业会左右政界人士.

sentences.en: The big companies dominate the lower price points.
sentences.cn: 大公司在低端价格领域占主导地位。

sentences.en: The book is expected to dominate the best-seller lists.
sentences.cn: 这本书预计会占据畅销书排行榜的榜首。

sentences.en: The cathedral dominates the city.
sentences.cn: 大教堂俯视全城。

sentences.en: The giant jets that increasingly dominate the world's airways.
sentences.cn: 越来越称雄于世界航线的巨型喷气机.

sentences.en: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.cn: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.en: The strong usually dominate over the weak.
sentences.cn: 强者常常支配弱者.

sentences.en: They had the ambition to dominate this small country.
sentences.cn: 他们有控制这个小国的野心.

sentences.en: This, then, was the music that appeared to dominate the world of serious concert music in the mid-1960s.
sentences.cn: 这就是20世纪60年代中期严肃的管弦乐中的主流音乐。

sentences.en: When they were in company she always seemed to dominate the conversation.
sentences.cn: 他们在一起的时候，她好像总是操纵着话语权。

words.tran_cn: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
占主导地位的；强势的；占统治地位的；[数] 受控的
控制，支配；处于支配地位（dominate的过去式）

trans.tran_cn: 在…中占首要地位，控制，支配，俯视，高耸于
trans.tran_en: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

trans.tran_cn: 处于支配地位， 拥有优势
trans.tran_en: To dominate a situation means to be the most powerful or important person or thing in it

trans.tran_cn: 在…中占首要地位；主宰，支配，统治，控制；占优势；耸立于，俯视
trans.tran_en: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things
